metadata.Title: CVE-2022-24810 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
net-snmp: A malformed OID in a SET to the nsVacmAccessTable can cause a NULL pointer dereference.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-24810` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnetsnmptrapd40 - 5.9.1+dfsg-1ubuntu2.2
libsnmp-base - 5.9.1+dfsg-1ubuntu2.2
libsnmp-perl - 5.9.1+dfsg-1ubuntu2.2
libsnmp40 - 5.9.1+dfsg-1ubuntu2.2
snmp - 5.9.1+dfsg-1ubuntu2.2
snmpd - 5.9.1+dfsg-1ubuntu2.2
snmptrapd - 5.9.1+dfsg-1ubuntu2.2
tkmib - 5.9.1+dfsg-1ubuntu2.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: net-snmp package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.9.1+dfsg-1ubuntu2.2').
